org.asoem.greyfish.utils.math.statistics

Class Samplings

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.asoem.greyfish.utils.math.statistics.Samplings

  • public final class Samplings
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of common Sampling implementations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Sampling<java.lang.Comparable<?>> bestSelection()
      This sampling scheme returns k times the the best element, which is the one with the highest rank defined by the natural ordering of the elements.

    • Method Detail

      • rouletteWheelSelection

        public static <E> Sampling<E> rouletteWheelSelection(com.google.common.base.Function<? super E,java.lang.Double> fitnessFunction,
                                                     org.apache.commons.math3.random.RandomGenerator rng)
        A selection scheme which samples elements proportionate to their fitness defined by the given fitnessFunction.

        This scheme is also known as stochastic sampling with replacement and therefore equivalent to Samplings.stochastic(fitnessFunction, rng).withReplacement().

        Parameters:
        fitnessFunction - the function to compute the fitness of the elements
        rng - the random generator
        Returns:
        the strategy to select k elements by using a roulette wheel

      • stochastic

        public static <E> ReplacementVariants<E> stochastic(com.google.common.base.Function<? super E,java.lang.Double> fitnessFunction,
                                                    org.apache.commons.math3.random.RandomGenerator rng)

      • elitistSelection

        public static Sampling<java.lang.Comparable<?>> elitistSelection()
        A the selection strategy for which the Sampling.sample(java.util.Collection, int) method returns the k best elements out of n elements.
        Returns:
        the strategy to select the k "best" elements of a collection

      • elitistSelection

        public static <T> Sampling<T> elitistSelection(com.google.common.collect.Ordering<? super T> ordering)

      • bestSelection

        public static Sampling<java.lang.Comparable<?>> bestSelection()
        This sampling scheme returns k times the the best element, which is the one with the highest rank defined by the natural ordering of the elements.
        Returns:
        a sampling scheme returning the "best" element of a collection
        See Also:
        Ordering.natural()

        public static <T> Sampling<T> bestSelection(com.google.common.collect.Ordering<? super T> ordering)
